snippet: The decision by Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey to have a special election to fill the seat of the late Senator Frank R. Lautenberg annoyed both parties.
abstract: Decision by Gov Chris Christie of New Jersey to hold special election to fill seat of late Sen Frank R Lautenberg in October, just three weeks before Election Day, is rich with political reward and risk; critics say election, which will cost state $24 million, is being held simply to cut down on the number of Democrats brought to the polls in November, a threat to Christie's seeming cruise toward re-election.
lead_paragraph: The decision by Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey to have a special election to fill the seat of the late Senator Frank R. Lautenberg annoyed both parties.

headline.seo: Choice of Special Election Typifies Christie: Fast and Calculated
headline.main: Election Move Typifies Christie: Fast and With Politics in Mind
headline.print_headline: Move on Senate Election Typifies Christie: Fast and With Politics in Mind
